title: Derivados Avanzados: Swaps y CDS

sections.title: Vocabulario: Swaps y Credit Default Swaps
sections.content:
C1 nivel. Instrumentos para la gestión de riesgos sistémicos.

- **Interest Rate Swap**: Swap de tipos de interés (intercambio de fijo por variable)
- **Credit Default Swap (CDS)**: Seguro contra impago de deuda
- **Counterparty risk**: Riesgo de contraparte
- **Notional amount**: Importe nocional
- **Fixed vs Floating rate**: Tipo fijo vs variable
- **Underlying debt**: Deuda subyacente
- **Credit event**: Evento de crédito (impago, reestructuración)
- **Collateral**: Colateral / Garantía

sections.title: Gramática: Past Subjunctive for High-Level Hypotheses
sections.content:
Usamos el **Past Subjunctive** (were) y estructuras irreales para discutir vulnerabilidades sistémicas.

- If the counterparty **were** to default, the entire system would be compromised.
- It is as though the market **had** no memory of the 2008 crisis.
- Suppose the ECB **were** to raise rates by 200 basis points; how would our swaps be affected?
- I would rather we **hedged** the position now than waited for a credit event.

keyTerms.definition: A financial derivative or contract that allows an investor to 'swap' or offset their credit risk with that of another investor.
The nominal or face value that is used to calculate payments on a financial instrument.
